faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Basic setup takes about 10-15 minutes. You can start adding vehicles right away. For larger data volumes, we're happy to help with the import.
faq.q2: Can I import my existing data?
faq.a2: Yes, you can import Excel lists and data from other systems. Our support helps you free of charge.
faq.a3: All data is stored exclusively in Switzerland. We use Swiss data centers and meet all GDPR requirements.
faq.a4: Yes, you can cancel monthly. No minimum contract period, no hidden costs. You can export your data at any time.
faq.a5: Dealer OS is intuitive and largely self-explanatory. If needed, we offer free video tutorials and personal onboarding.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Basics and navigation in Dealer OS

first-steps.title: First Steps with Dealer OS
first-steps.description: Learn the basics and get familiar with the system.
first-steps.content:
Welcome to Dealer OS! This guide helps you become productive quickly.

What is Dealer OS?

Dealer OS is an all-in-one software for Swiss car dealers and garages. It combines vehicle management, customer management, quotes, invoices and analytics in one platform.

Key Areas

  • Overview: Your dashboard with key metrics
  • Inventory: Manage all your vehicles
  • Leads: Handle inquiries and customer requests
  • Customers: Maintain customer data
  • Quotes & Invoices: Create offers and invoice
steps: Complete your company profile in Settings
Add your first vehicle to inventory
Explore the dashboard for an overview
tips: Start with a few test vehicles
Use the search function for quick access
Enable email notifications for important updates

navigation.title: Navigation & Layout
navigation.description: How to find your way around Dealer OS.
navigation.content:
Dealer OS has a clear layout. The main navigation is on the left, the workspace on the right.

Sidebar (left)

The sidebar contains all main areas, organized in logical groups:

  • Overview & Inventory: Daily vehicle work
  • Sales: Customers, quotes, invoices
  • Communication: Email templates, WhatsApp
  • Analytics: Reports and evaluations

Location Filter

If you have multiple locations, you can switch between them or view all at the top of the sidebar.
tips: Click the logo to return to the overview
The location filter affects all views
Use the language switcher for your preferred language

settings-overview.title: Configure Settings
settings-overview.description: Customize Dealer OS for your needs.
settings-overview.content:
In settings, you configure Dealer OS for your business.

Important Settings

  • Company Profile: Name, address, logo for documents
  • Locations: Manage multiple branches
  • Users: Invite team members
  • Integrations: Connect Bexio, WhatsApp and more
  • Email Templates: Customize standard texts
steps: Go to Settings in the sidebar
Select 'Company Profile' and complete your data
Set up additional locations if needed

add-vehicle.title: Add a Vehicle
add-vehicle.description: How to add a new vehicle to your inventory.
add-vehicle.content:
Adding a new vehicle takes just a few minutes. Enter the key data ‚Äì the rest can be added later.

Required Fields

  • Make & Model: e.g. BMW 320d
  • First Registration: For age calculation
  • Mileage: Current reading
  • Price: Selling price

Optional Information

The more data you enter, the more meaningful your analytics: purchase price, preparation costs, extras, etc.
tips: Enter purchase price for margin calculation
More complete data means better analytics
Vehicle status is automatically set to 'Available'

edit-vehicle.title: Edit a Vehicle
edit-vehicle.description: Update vehicle data and change status.
edit-vehicle.content:
Keep your vehicle data current. Price changes, status updates or additional information can be adjusted anytime.

Vehicle Status

  • Available: Actively for sale
  • Reserved: Held for a customer
  • Sold: Successfully completed

Price History

Every price change is logged. You can later see how the price developed.
steps: Open the vehicle from the inventory list
tips: Use 'Reserved' when a customer shows interest
Document reasons for price changes in notes

vehicle-photos.title: Upload Photos
vehicle-photos.content:
Good photos are crucial for sales. Upload multiple images per vehicle.

Recommended Shots

  • Front and rear (angled)
  • Both sides
  • Interior (dashboard, seats, trunk)
  • Special features
  • Any damage (for transparency)

Image Formats

JPG and PNG are supported. Maximum file size: 10 MB per image.
steps: Click 'Upload Photos' or drag images into the area
The first image becomes the main image
tips: Photograph in good daylight
8-12 images per vehicle is ideal
The main image appears in lists and on listings

standtime-alerts.title: Days-on-Lot Alerts
standtime-alerts.description: Identify slow movers and act in time.
standtime-alerts.content:
Vehicles that sit too long tie up capital and lose value. Dealer OS alerts you automatically.

Warning Levels

  • 30 Days (Yellow): First attention
  • 60 Days (Orange): Review pricing
  • 90 Days (Red): Urgent action needed

Recommended Actions

For long standers: adjust price, optimize listing, actively promote or wholesale.
tips: Review your slow movers weekly
5% price reduction every 30 days as guideline
Document actions in vehicle notes

manage-leads.title: Manage Leads
manage-leads.content:
Leads are potential customers who have shown interest in a vehicle. Quick and professional handling increases your close rate.

Lead Sources

  • Website form
  • Email inquiries
  • Phone calls (manually entered)
  • WhatsApp messages
  • Listing portals

Key Information

Capture for each lead: contact details, interested vehicle, budget, timeframe.
steps: New leads appear at the top
Link lead to customer when interested
tips: Respond within 1 hour for best results
Use templates for frequent responses
Also log phone inquiries as leads

lead-status.title: Understanding Lead Status
lead-status.description: The different stages of a customer inquiry.
lead-status.content:
Lead status shows where a prospect is in the sales process.

Status Overview

  • New: Not yet processed
  • Contacted: First response sent
  • Interested: Active buying interest
  • Viewing: Appointment scheduled
  • Negotiating: Price negotiation ongoing
  • Won: Sale completed
  • Lost: No deal
tips: Keep status current for accurate reports
Note the reason when marking 'Lost'
Won leads improve your conversion rate in analytics

follow-up.title: Follow-ups & Reminders
follow-up.description: Never forget an inquiry ‚Äì automatic follow-up.
follow-up.content:
Many sales require multiple contacts. Follow-ups help you stay on track.

Follow-up Rules

  • After first response: wait 2-3 days
  • After viewing: follow up next day
  • After quote: give 1 week to decide
steps: You'll receive a notification at the time
tips: Set the next follow-up right after each contact
Mornings 9-11 AM often reach customers best
Max 3 follow-ups without response, then mark 'Lost'

customers.title: Customer Management
customers.description: Build and maintain your customer base

add-customer.title: Add a Customer
add-customer.description: How to create a new customer.
add-customer.content:
A well-maintained customer base is the foundation for quotes, invoices and repeat purchases.

Required Fields

  • Customer Type: Individual or Company
  • Name: First and last name or company name
  • Email or Phone: At least one contact method

Address Data

For quotes and invoices, you need the complete address.
tips: For companies: also add a contact person
VAT ID for business customers for correct invoices
Customers sync automatically with Bexio (if connected)

customer-types.title: Individual vs. Business Customers
customer-types.content:
Different requirements apply depending on customer type for documents and invoicing.

Individuals

  • Salutation, first and last name
  • Prices incl. VAT
  • No VAT ID required

Business Customers

  • Company name + contact person
  • VAT ID for B2B invoices
  • Prices excl. VAT (optional)
tips: For leasing companies: create as business with separate driver note
Dealer sales: own category for reports

customer-history.title: Customer History
customer-history.content:
Customer history shows all past interactions, purchases and documents.

What's Stored?

  • All leads/inquiries from the customer
  • Created quotes
  • Issued invoices
  • Purchased vehicles
  • Notes and comments
tips: Review history before a call
Regular customers deserve special attention
Use notes for personal details (hobbies, family)

create-quote.title: Create a Quote
create-quote.description: Step by step to a professional quote.
create-quote.content:
A well-structured quote increases your close rate. Dealer OS generates professional PDFs with your company logo.

Quote Components

  • Customer: Select from customer list
  • Vehicle: Link from inventory
  • Items: Vehicle price, accessories, warranty
  • Discount: Percentage or absolute
  • Trade-in: Vehicle taken in exchange
tips: Set a validity date (e.g. 14 days)
Add your bank details for deposits
Use preview before sending

quote-positions.title: Add Items
quote-positions.content:
A quote can contain multiple items. Structure your offer clearly.

Item Types

  • Vehicle: The main vehicle
  • Accessories: Winter tires, trailer hitch, etc.
  • Service: Preparation, delivery
  • Warranty: Additional warranty packages
  • Discount: Price reductions
tips: List each item separately ‚Äì transparency builds trust
Add cost price for accessories for margin calculation
Use discount items instead of manual price adjustment

send-quote.title: Send a Quote
send-quote.description: Via email or PDF to the customer.
send-quote.content:
Send quotes directly from Dealer OS. The customer receives a professional PDF.

Sending Options

  • Email: Directly from the system with tracking
  • PDF Download: For manual sending or printing
  • WhatsApp: Link to online view

Tracking

You can see when the customer opened the quote (when sent by email).
tips: Personalize the message
Call 1-2 days after sending
No response: activate automatic follow-up

convert-invoice.title: Convert Quote to Invoice
convert-invoice.description: From offer to invoice in one click.
convert-invoice.content:
When the customer accepts the quote, convert it to an invoice. All data is transferred.

What's Transferred?

  • Customer data
  • All items
  • Discounts and trade-in
  • Linked vehicle
tips: Quote remains as reference
Vehicle status automatically set to 'Sold'
Invoice syncs with Bexio (if connected)

create-invoice.title: Create an Invoice
create-invoice.content:
Create invoices manually or from an accepted quote.

Invoice Content

  • Invoice Number: Automatically assigned
  • Invoice Date: Default: today
  • Due Date: Per your payment terms
  • Items: Same as quotes

VAT Handling

Swiss VAT is calculated automatically (8.1%). For business customers, excl. VAT can be shown.
tips: For vehicle sales: always convert from quote
QR invoice is generated automatically
Invoice number is sequential and cannot be changed

payment-tracking.title: Track Payments
payment-tracking.description: Record payments and monitor outstanding amounts.
payment-tracking.content:
Keep track of paid and outstanding invoices.

Payment Status

  • Draft: Not yet sent
  • Sent: With customer
  • Partial: Deposit received
  • Paid: Fully settled
  • Overdue: Past due date unpaid
tips: Record partial payments separately
Reconcile regularly with your bank account
With Bexio: payments sync automatically

reminders.title: Send Reminders
reminders.content:
For missing payments, a structured reminder process helps.

Reminder Levels

  • Payment Reminder: Friendly note after 7 days
  • 1st Reminder: After 14 days, factual
  • 2nd Reminder: After 30 days, with deadline
  • Final Reminder: Warning of legal action
tips: Call briefly before the first reminder
Document all reminders
For chronic debtors: no more business without prepayment

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: Connect Dealer OS with other tools

bexio-setup.title: Connect Bexio
bexio-setup.content:
Connect Dealer OS with Bexio for automatic synchronization of customers, quotes and invoices.

What's Synchronized?

  • Customers: Bidirectional (both ways)
  • Quotes: From Dealer OS to Bexio
  • Invoices: From Dealer OS to Bexio
  • Payments: From Bexio to Dealer OS

Requirements

You need an active Bexio account and API access (Bexio Pro or higher).
tips: Test with a few records
Set a default VAT rate
Check the account mapping in Bexio

whatsapp-setup.title: Set Up WhatsApp
whatsapp-setup.content:
Connect your WhatsApp Business number with Dealer OS for direct customer communication.

Features

  • Receive messages directly in dashboard
  • Quick replies and templates
  • Automatic lead creation
  • Send and receive media
steps: Scan the QR code with WhatsApp Business
Test with a message to your number
tips: Use a dedicated business number
Set up automatic greeting
Respond quickly ‚Äì WhatsApp customers expect it

email-templates.title: Customize Email Templates
email-templates.content:
Customize email templates to your style. Templates are used for quotes, invoices and reminders.

Available Templates

  • Quote sending
  • Invoice sending
  • Payment reminder
  • 1st/2nd/3rd reminder
  • General inquiry response

Placeholders

Use placeholders like {'{customername}'}, {'{vehicle}'}, {'{amount}'} for automatic personalization.
steps: Save and test with a test email
tips: Keep emails short and personal
Include your signature with contact details
Test each template before productive use

dashboard-overview.title: Understanding the Dashboard
dashboard-overview.content:
The dashboard shows your most important KPIs in real-time.

Key Metrics

  • Inventory: Number of vehicles, total value
  • Avg. Days on Lot: Average days until sale
  • Open Leads: Unprocessed inquiries
  • Avg. Margin: Average profit per vehicle
  • Revenue: Monthly and yearly comparison
tips: Check the dashboard daily in the morning
Red numbers require immediate attention
Compare values with previous month

reports.title: Generate Reports
reports.content:
Create detailed reports for different time periods and categories.

Available Reports

  • Inventory Report: All vehicles with days on lot and margin
  • Sales Report: Completed sales in period
  • Lead Report: Conversion rates and sources
  • Revenue Report: Income and trends
steps: Optional: filter by location or category
tips: Monthly reports at month end for accounting
Compare quarters for trends
Export as Excel for further analysis

export-data.title: Export Data
export-data.content:
Export your data for accounting, taxes or analysis.

Export Formats

  • Excel (.xlsx): For spreadsheets
  • CSV: For import into other systems
  • PDF: For archiving and printing

Exportable Data

Vehicles, customers, quotes, invoices, leads ‚Äì everything can be exported.
tips: Regular backups recommended
CSV for data import into other software
PDF export for legally compliant archiving
